channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: In the Faroe Islands’ Soccer Team, the Players Also Have Day Jobs
item.description: The Faroe Islands, rugged green specks in the North Atlantic, are an underdog. Most of the guys on the team have day jobs.

item.title: Record U.S. government shutdown is over—but Wall Street only has 10 weeks to relax before the next one could begin
item.description: U.S. government shutdown ends after 43 days, but markets brace for another funding fight as investors weigh lost data and Fed uncertainty.

item.title: How the Government Will Reopen, and What’s in the Epstein Emails
Trump Administration Expected to Drastically Cut Housing Grants
item.description: In a major shift, HUD’s plan would direct most of the $3.5 billion in homelessness funds away from Housing First to programs that prioritize work and ...

item.title: New Cash App features let users send and receive stablecoins, pay merchants in Bitcoin
item.description: Dorsey, who also cofounded Twitter, has long been a Bitcoin devotee.

item.title: The CEO of $2.2 billion AI company Turing can’t live without ChatGPT, swears by his Kindle, and has only taken 2 weeks of vacation in 7 years
item.description: Turing cofounder and CEO Jonathan Siddharth loves his VR headset, F1 video games, and Oura ring, but says the greatest investment is “creating memorie...

item.title: Hilton’s CEO focused on rebuilding the hotel giant’s culture. Now its staff turnover is about half the industry average
item.description: Also: All the news and watercooler chat from Fortune.

item.title: Russia’s first AI-powered robot walked on stage to triumphant music, took a few steps, and then immediately faceplanted
item.description: AIdol has some work to do before it can catch up to its western competition.

item.title: Ukraine’s Dilemma as Pokrovsk Teeters: Save Lives or Keep Holding On
item.description: Military analysts and some Ukrainian commanders worry that Kyiv may be repeating the mistake of staying in an embattled city longer than it should, ai...

item.title: I Watched This Haven From War Turn Into a Besieged Wasteland
item.description: The Ukrainian city of Pokrovsk is on the verge of becoming another shattered trophy for the Russian Army.

item.title: In the Faroe Islands’ Soccer Team, the Players Also Have Day Jobs
item.description: The Faroe Islands, rugged green specks in the North Atlantic, are an underdog. Most of the guys on the team have day jobs.

item.title: Juan Ponce Enrile, a Political Power in the Philippines, Dies at 101
item.description: A protégé of Ferdinand Marcos, he helped administer eight years of martial law before turning on his patron in the “People Power” uprising of 1986.

item.title: China’s ‘Wolf Warrior’ Diplomacy Returns With Threat Against Japan’s Leader
item.description: A Chinese diplomat’s call to cut off the prime minister’s “filthy head” signaled a revival of a combative style Beijing had tried to dial back.

item.title: I Watched This Haven From War Turn Into a Besieged Wasteland
